label.value: Sprint increases your [color=title]lateral movement speed[/color], allowing for quicker travel and easier enemy evasion.
Sprint increases your [color=title]lateral movement speed[/color], allowing for quicker travel and easier enemy evasion.

If you unlock [color=title]Sprint[/color], you will lose access to the [color=title]Matrix[/color] skill.
Higher levels of [color=title]Sprint[/color] offer small [color=title]speed increases[/color] while incrementally decreasing the base [color=title]recharge time[/color].
You will no longer have access to the [color=title]Matrix[/color] skill.

The first upgrade to Sprint increases the [color=title]rate[/color] and [color=title]duration[/color] of your sprint by small amounts. It also reduces the [color=title]recharge time[/color] by 2 seconds.

If you unlock Sprint, you will lose access to the [color=title]Matrix[/color] skill.
Future upgrades to Sprint will extend the duration for which you can sprint as well as shorten the recharge time.
The final upgrade to Sprint maximizes the [color=title]speed bonus[/color] and [color=title]duration[/color] of the skill. The [color=title]recharge time[/color] will also decrease by a small amount.
You have fully upgraded Sprint. You have the maximum possible [color=title]speed bonus[/color] and [color=title]duration[/color] of the skill.
Matrix momentarily slows the movement speed of each [color=title]enemy[/color], buying you time to escape looming posses or to complete advanced digging puzzles.
Matrix momentarily slows the movement speed of each [color=title]enemy[/color], buying you time to escape looming posses or to complete advanced digging puzzles.

If you unlock [color=title]Matrix[/color], you will lose access to the [color=title]Sprint[/color] skill.
As you continue to upgrade [color=title]Matrix[/color], enemies will move even more slowly for even longer durations.
You will no longer have access to the [color=title]Sprint[/color] skill.
Amplify the power of the [color=title]Matrix[/color] effect, further slowing enemies' speed.

Fully enhance the [color=title]Matrix[/color] effect's strength, allowing you to dominate enemies.
Any enemy within a [color=title]radius of 2 blocks[/color] will now freeze completely for [color=title]1 second[/color].

You have fully enhanced the [color=title]Matrix[/color] effect's strength. Any enemy within a [color=title]radius of 2 blocks[/color] will now freeze completely for [color=title]1 second[/color] when you activate the skill.
The [color=title]Hacking[/color] skill automatically reveals portions of terminal [color=title]keycodes[/color]. It also unlocks advanced options when accessing [color=title]terminals[/color].
The [color=title]Hacking[/color] skill automatically reveals portions of terminal [color=title]keycodes[/color]. It also unlocks advanced options when accessing [color=title]terminals[/color].

If you unlock [color=title]Hacking[/color], you will lose access to the [color=title]Persuasion[/color] skill.
Higher levels of [color=title]Hacking[/color] will reveal [color=title]longer portions[/color] of passcodes. Each upgrade will also expose higher-security options on [color=title]terminals[/color].
You will no longer have access to the [color=title]Persuasion[/color] skill.
You do not need to equip the [color=title]Hacking[/color] skill. It will perform its function automatically.

At Level 2, the [color=title]Hacking[/color] skill reveals an additional digit in each passcode. You will also gain access to [color=title]mid-grade security selections[/color] when viewing terminal screens.

When fully upgraded, the [color=title]Hacking[/color] skill reveals [color=title]5 digits[/color] of any code. This oftentimes provides you the entire keycode.
At this level, you will gain access to every [color=title]secure terminal option[/color] you encounter.
Doing so will fully upgrade your [color=title]Hacking[/color] skill.

You have finished upgrading the [color=title]Hacking[/color] skill. Key panels will now reveal up to [color=title]5 digits[/color] of any code.
At this level, you will gain access to every [color=title]secure terminal option[/color] you encounter.

Persuasion [color=title]automatically[/color] takes effect during [color=title]dialogue sequences[/color]. Using Persuasion allows you to exert an unusual amount of [color=dim]control[/color] over the people you talk to, enabling special [color=title]dialogue responses[/color].

Persuasion [color=title]automatically[/color] takes effect during [color=title]dialogue sequences[/color]. Using Persuasion allows you to exert an unusual amount of [color=dim]control[/color] over the people you talk to, enabling special [color=title]dialogue responses[/color].

If you unlock [color=title]Persuasion[/color], you will lose access to the [color=title]Hacking[/color] skill.
Further upgrades to [color=title]Persuasion[/color] will lower [color=title]shoppe prices[/color] and increase your overall [color=title]persuasiveness[/color].
You will no longer have access to the [color=title]Hacking[/color] skill.
You do not need to equip the [color=title]Persuasion[/color] skill. It will perform its function automatically during dialogue sequences.

By upgrading [color=title]Persuasion[/color] skill to Level 2, you will gain a small [color=dim]discount[/color] in all shoppes.
You will also obtain access to more [color=title]dialogue response[/color] options.

The final upgrade to [color=dim]Persuasion[/color] more than doubles the discount you receive in shoppes.
At this level, you will have access to [color=title]all dialogue responses[/color].
Doing so will fully upgrade your [color=title]Persuasion[/color] skill.

You have mastered The [color=title]Persuasion[/color] skill. You receive the highest possible [color=title]discount[/color] in shoppes, and you have access to all [color=title]dialogue responses[/color].
Cast out a [color=title]holographic decoy[/color] that looks just like you, stealing each enemy's attention for a moment.
Cast out a [color=title]holographic decoy[/color] that looks just like you, stealing each enemy's attention for a moment.

If you unlock [color=title]Hologram[/color], you will lose access to the [color=title]Fright[/color] skill.
As you upgrade the [color=title]Hologram[/color], it will gain the ability to collect [color=title]gold[/color] and to [color=title]explode when hitting walls[/color].
You will no longer have access to the [color=title]Fright[/color] skill.
The first upgrade to [color=dim]Hologram[/color] increases the lifespan of the [color=dim]decoy[/color]. As well, the Hologram gains the ability to [color=title]collect gold[/color].

Hologram's highest upgrade tops out the decoy's [color=dim]lifespan[/color]. In addition to collecting [color=title]gold[/color], the Hologram will now [color=title]explode[/color] when it hits a wall.
Doing so will fully upgrade your [color=title]Hologram[/color] skill.
Pay close attention to your [color=title]Hologram[/color]. When it runs into a wall, it will [color=title]explode[/color] and destroy anything nearby!

You have maxed out the [color=title]Hologram[/color] skill, maximizing its [color=dim]lifespan[/color]. It now both collects [color=title]gold[/color] and also [color=title]explodes[/color] when it runs into a wall.
[color=title]Fright[/color] casts a momentary sense of [color=title]panic[/color] upon your foes. Each foe will flee your location at any cost!
[color=title]Fright[/color] casts a momentary sense of [color=title]panic[/color] upon your foes. Each foe will flee your location at any cost!

If you unlock [color=title]Fright[/color], you will lose access to the [color=title]Hologram[/color] skill.
Later upgrades to [color=title]Fright[/color] will make enemies flee at [color=title]greater speeds[/color] for [color=title]longer durations[/color]. The highest upgrade adds a satisfying, combustible side effect to the skill.
You will no longer have access to the [color=title]Hologram[/color] skill.
The starter upgrade to [color=title]Fright[/color] lengthens the effect's [color=title]duration[/color] and increases the speed at which enemies [color=title]flee[/color] your location.

[color=title]Fright[/color]'s final upgrade sets the highest possible [color=title]duration[/color] and [color=title]flee speed[/color]. Any given enemy now stands a chance to [color=title]spontaneously explode[/color] in pure terror when you use [color=title]Fright[/color].
Doing so will fully upgrade your [color=title]Fright[/color] skill.

Unlocking [color=dim]Fright[/color]'s final upgrade earned you the highest [color=title]duration[/color] and [color=title]flee speed[/color]. Also, each enemy now stands a chance to [color=title]spontaneously explode[/color] in pure terror when you use [color=title]Fright[/color].
The [color=title]Jackhammer[/color] skill allows you to dig [color=title]multiple tiles[/color] into the ground with a single blast of your mining laser.
The [color=title]Jackhammer[/color] skill allows you to dig [color=title]multiple tiles[/color] into the ground with a single blast of your mining laser.

If you unlock [color=title]Jackhammer[/color], you will lose access to the [color=title]Earth Mover[/color] skill.
Future upgrades to this skill will increase the [color=title]depth[/color] of each dig and delay the tile refill.
You will no longer have access to the [color=title]Earth Mover[/color] skill.
[color=title]Jackhammer[/color]'s opening upgrade increases the depth of each dig by [color=title]one tile[/color]. Each of the tiles will wait a moment longer before [color=title]refilling[/color].

The final [color=title]Jackhammer[/color] upgrade substantially reduces the [color=title]recharge time[/color]. Tiles you dig with this skill will wait even longer before [color=title]refilling[/color].
Doing so will fully upgrade your [color=title]Jackhammer[/color] skill.

You have acquired the final [color=title]Jackhammer[/color] upgrade. It substantially reduces the skill's [color=title]recharge time[/color], and tiles you dig with this skill will wait even longer before [color=title]refilling[/color].
[color=title]Earthmover[/color] gives you the power to dig [color=title]multiple tiles[/color] ahead of your location with one blast of your mining laser.
[color=title]Earthmover[/color] gives you the power to dig [color=title]multiple tiles[/color] ahead of your location with one blast of your mining laser.

If you unlock [color=title]Earth Mover[/color], you will lose access to the [color=title]Jackhammer[/color] skill.
Further upgrades to [color=title]Earth Mover[/color] will increase the [color=title]distance[/color] of each dig and extend the duration of the dig on each tile.
You will no longer have access to the [color=title]Jackhammer[/color] skill.

The beginning upgrade to [color=title]Earth Mover[/color] extends the distance of the dig by [color=dim]one tile[/color]. In conjunction, [color=title]Earth Mover[/color] now causes delays [color=title]tile refill[/color] for a brief period of time.

[color=title]Earth Mover[/color]'s last upgrade greatly reduces the skill's total [color=dim]recharge time[/color]. Each tile you dig with [color=title]Earth Mover[/color] will remain unfilled for even longer.
Doing so will fully upgrade your [color=title]Earth Mover[/color] skill.
You have now fully upgraded [color=title]Earth Mover[/color].

You fully upgraded [color=title]Earth Mover[/color], greatly reducing the skill's total [color=dim]recharge time[/color]. Each tile you dig with [color=title]Earth Mover[/color] now remains unfilled for longer than ever before.

[color=title]Shield[/color] grants you [color=title]time-limited invincibility[/color] against all damage in the game. Its timer steadily decreases over time, and any [color=title]damage[/color] you suffer accelerates that timer's decrease.

[color=title]Shield[/color] grants you [color=title]time-limited invincibility[/color] against all damage in the game. Its timer steadily decreases over time, and any [color=title]damage[/color] you suffer accelerates that timer's decrease.

If you unlock [color=title]Shield[/color], you will lose access to the [color=title]Wall[/color] skill.
Further upgrading the [color=title]Shield[/color] skill will increase the shield's initial duration and lessen the [color=title]time penalty[/color] you endure when taking damage.
You will no longer have access to the [color=title]Wall[/color] skill.

The alpha [color=title]Shield[/color] upgrade extends the [color=dim]base duration[/color] of the effect. It also absorbs a small percentage of any [color=title]damage[/color] you incur, allowing the shield to withstand more punishment.

Fully upgrading the [color=title]Shield[/color] skill maximizes the [color=title]base duration[/color] of the shield. It also absorbs even more damage, providing you with the best possible damage protection.
Doing so will fully upgrade your [color=title]Shield[/color] skill.

Your fully-upgraded [color=title]Shield[/color] skill maximizes the [color=title]base duration[/color] of the shield. It also absorbs even more damage, providing you with the best possible damage protection.
Use the [color=title]Wall[/color] skill to place a temporary wall a step in front of your character, keeping enemies at bay.
Use the [color=title]Wall[/color] skill to place a temporary wall a step in front of your character, keeping enemies at bay.

If you unlock [color=title]Wall[/color], you will lose access to the [color=title]Shield[/color] skill.
As you upgrade the [color=title]Wall[/color] skill, its [color=title]duration[/color] will increase. The final upgrade turns the wall into a useful [color=title]weapon[/color].
You will no longer have access to the [color=title]Shield[/color] skill.
The beginning upgrade to [color=title]Wall[/color] extends the [color=title]duration[/color] of the wall and lowers the [color=title]recharge time[/color].

The last [color=title]Wall[/color] upgrade maximizes the [color=title]duration[/color] of the wall. The [color=title]Wall[/color] now has [color=title]deadly spikes[/color] on the opposite side. The spikes will destroy anything that touches them.
Doing so will fully upgrade your [color=title]Wall[/color] skill.

You unlocked The last [color=title]Wall[/color] upgrade, maximizing the wall's [color=title]duration[/color]. The [color=title]Wall[/color] now has [color=title]deadly spikes[/color] on the opposite side. The spikes will destroy anything that touches them.
Place a [color=title]bomb[/color] that does not explode until you [color=title]manually detonate[/color] the bomb.
Place a [color=title]bomb[/color] that does not explode until you [color=title]manually detonate[/color] the bomb.

If you unlock [color=title]Remote Bomb[/color], you will lose access to the [color=title]Mega Bomb[/color] skill.
As you upgrade this skill, you will gain the ability to place [color=title]multiple remote bombs[/color] and to then detonate all of them simultaneously.
You will no longer have access to the [color=title]Mega Bomb[/color] skill.
The first [color=title]Remote Bomb[/color] upgrade allows you to place up to [color=title]2 remote bombs[/color] before triggering the detonation.
After you place one [color=title]remote bomb[/color], the next [color=title]regular bomb[/color] you place will automatically become a [color=dim]remote bomb[/color].
Triggering the Remote Bomb [color=title]detonation[/color] will detonate any existing remote bomb.
The last upgrade to [color=title]Remote Bomb[/color] enables you to place up to [color=title]3 remote bombs[/color] before triggering the detonation.
Doing so will fully upgrade your [color=title]Remote Bomb[/color] skill.
After you place one [color=title]remote bomb[/color], the next [color=title]2 regular bombs[/color] you place will automatically become [color=dim]remote bombs[/color].
Triggering the Remote Bomb [color=title]detonation[/color] will detonate any existing remote bomb.
You have now fully upgraded [color=title]Remote Bomb[/color].
You have obtained the highest upgrade to [color=title]Remote Bomb[/color], enabling you to place up to [color=title]3 remote bombs[/color] before triggering the detonation.

[color=title]Mega Bomb[/color] supercharges the power of a bomb, increasing the blast radius and causing rampant destruction. Using a Mega Bomb will require [color=title]2 ordinary bombs[/color] to fuel the explosion.

[color=title]Mega Bomb[/color] supercharges the power of a bomb, increasing the blast radius and causing rampant destruction. Using a Mega Bomb will require [color=title]2 ordinary bombs[/color] to fuel the explosion.

If you unlock [color=title]Mega Bomb[/color], you will lose access to the [color=title]Remote Bomb[/color] skill.
Future upgrades to [color=title]Mega Bomb[/color] reduce the [color=title]bomb fuel requirement[/color] and eventually increase the [color=title]blast radius[/color].
You will no longer have access to the [color=title]Remote Bomb[/color] skill.
The first upgrade to [color=title]Mega Bomb[/color] reduces the fuel requirement to [color=title]1 bomb[/color]. The blast radius remains the same.

If you brave the final upgrade to [color=title]Mega Bomb[/color], you will destroy entire levels. You will need [color=special]3 bombs[/color] for each use of this highest-powered [color=title]Mega Bomb[/color].
Doing so will fully upgrade your [color=title]Mega Bomb[/color] skill.
You have now fully upgraded [color=title]Mega Bomb[/color].
You have reached the highest upgrade of [color=title]Mega Bomb[/color]. You need [color=special]3 bombs[/color] for each use of this highest-powered [color=title]Mega Bomb[/color].
[color=title]Invisibility[/color] allows you to hide from enemies for a short span of time. During this interval, the enemies will seek your [color=title]last known position[/color].
[color=title]Invisibility[/color] allows you to hide from enemies for a short span of time. During this interval, the enemies will seek your [color=title]last known position[/color].

If you unlock [color=title]Invisibility[/color], you will lose access to the [color=title]Pickpocket[/color] skill.
This skill has a very high [color=title]recharge time[/color]. Future upgrades to [color=title]Invisibility[/color] will diminish that recharge time.
You will no longer have access to the [color=title]Pickpocket[/color] skill.
The first upgrade to [color=title]Invisibility[/color] slightly extends the duration of the effect. In addition, the skill will now [color=title]recharge[/color] more quickly.

The last upgrade for [color=title]Invisibility[/color] extends the overall duration of the skill. Additionally, [color=title]standing still[/color] while invisible will save [color=title]50%[/color] of the [color=title]timer drain[/color], allowing you to milk extra time out of the skill.
Doing so will fully upgrade your [color=title]Invisibility[/color] skill.

You unlocked the last upgrade for [color=title]Invisibility[/color], maximizing the overall duration of the skill. Additionally, [color=title]standing still[/color] while invisible saves [color=title]50%[/color] of the [color=title]timer drain[/color], allowing you to milk extra time out of the skill.
Use the [color=title]Pickpocket[/color] skill to steal [color=title]gold[/color] straight out of a nearby [color=title]enemy[/color]'s hands (without trapping them in the ground).
Use the [color=title]Pickpocket[/color] skill to steal [color=title]gold[/color] straight out of a nearby [color=title]enemy[/color]'s hands (without trapping them in the ground).

If you unlock [color=title]Pickpocket[/color], you will lose access to the [color=title]Invisibility[/color] skill.
Higher levels of [color=title]Pickpocket[/color] increase the [color=title]effective range[/color] of the skill and allow you to pickpocket [color=title]NPCs[/color].
You will no longer have access to the [color=title]Invisibility[/color] skill.
Obtaining the first upgrade to [color=title]Pickpocket[/color] doubles the skill's range, allowing you to steal gold from enemies approximately [color=title]halfway[/color] across the screen.

The final upgrade to [color=title]Pickpocket[/color] extends the range of the skill to [color=title]infinity[/color]. Also, the [color=title]Pickpocket[/color] skill will now attempt to steal [color=title]gold or items[/color] from friendly people in [color=title]town areas[/color].
Doing so will fully upgrade your [color=title]Pickpocket[/color] skill.

Having acquired the final upgrade to [color=title]Pickpocket[/color], you now have an [color=title]infinite[/color] pickpocket range. Also, the [color=title]Pickpocket[/color] skill now attempts to steal [color=title]gold or items[/color] from friendly people in [color=title]town areas[/color].
